channel.title: Hosting a server on a MAC
channel.description:
I'm using my friends old source. Everytime I try and host it for tests it will be like: "shops.cfg not found, globaldrops.cfg not found" ETC! Every config file aren't found on my mac. My mac version is 10.5.11..
Is there anyone who could help me, or would like to host for me?

item.title: Hosting a server on a MAC
item.dc:creator: @MrHead MrHead
item.description:
@MrHead wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:5, topic:523363”][quote author=MrHead link=topic=641912.msg4324005#msg4324005 date=1372599482]
At above:
I don’t think my mac is case dependent, even in our mac’s CMD [Terminal] it doesn’t have caps on the cfg files.

At above two, you would host for me?
[/quote]
It is, every *nix file system is. You have to look in the code, not what the terminal prints out. The other poster is probably just trying to steal your server[/quote]

In the code, where can I find that?

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting a server on a MAC

item.title: Hosting a server on a MAC
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“MrHead, post:4, topic:523363”]At above:
I don’t think my mac is case dependent, even in our mac’s CMD [Terminal] it doesn’t have caps on the cfg files.

At above two, you would host for me?[/quote]
It is, every *nix file system is. You have to look in the code, not what the terminal prints out. The other poster is probably just trying to steal your server

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting a server on a MAC
item.dc:creator: @MrHead MrHead
item.description:
@MrHead wrote:

At above:
I don’t think my mac is case dependent, even in our mac’s CMD [Terminal] it doesn’t have caps on the cfg files.

item.source: Hosting a server on a MAC

item.title: Hosting a server on a MAC
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

It is because *nix uses a filesystem that is case dependent, unlike Windows. Look through the code of the server and make sure the file is named identical to the way the server wants it.

Read full topic
item.source: Hosting a server on a MAC
